reviews.text: Appalling service from TFL especially when year on year they are raising the fair prices. On top of paying taxes and all other BS charges .... FIX UP TFL
Love the underground especially when a young man offers you a seat! So retro! So nice. Gentleman on left in photo. The new station at Southwalk is lovely.
Nice station with a welcome desk to Richmond but it could be nicer if it gets refurbished a little bit. There are nice shops around.

Overground and Underground train station with it's fair share of busy platforms, and Victorian ornate iron platform pillars.
Originally opened in 1846 as the terminus of it's line to Clapham Junction. 
Current Art Deco facade designed by James Robb Scott in portland stone in 1937 with a mahoosive square clock above it's main entrance. 
In close proximity to a plethora of buses and shops. Plus The Orange Tree Theatre and Richmond Theatre.
Located in a very nice area, City Guide located there, Good and patient employees who are responsive to passengers, Good connections to other parts of London....
